		Question: which country in europe has the largest land area
		Answer:
answer:
The answer is Russia.

The Geography of Europe is found in the reference text for this question. Russia has 11 time zones and covers more than one-eighth of the planet's land surface. With its total area of 17,075,200 square kilometers, it is the largest country in the world. Russia's sheer size and territorial expanse have significantly shaped its history and national identity.
